0bce53ce-3ddf-4b1e-a35a-b97797426d05.description: AMCOMP will certify professionals who demonstrate proficiency in workers' compensation by the successful completion of the WCP® course curriculum final exam. The certification will be designated as “WCP®” (Workers' Compensation Professional) and is a registered trademark of AMCOMP. Earners successfully complete the WCP course material and related assessments and the WCP final accreditation exam, inclusive of all chapters (closed-book) with a score of 70% or higher.

badge_template_activities.title: Business professions interested in receiving the designation must complete an application for the course they are interested in taking. The course is provided via self-study or a combination of self-study and virtual learning.

The cost of the designation varies depending on if the participant is taking it via self-study, virtual, and/or if they are a member of The American Society of Workers Compensation Insurance Professionals.

Earners have to complete a rigorous course covering general information material related to workers compensation and study content from the textbook Workers Compensation The first Hundred Years. Earners have 6 months to complete the course, chapter assessments, and prepare for the final assessment.
Earners receive a 70% or higher on the final accreditation exam (closed book).
